question.title: Reset All Bits
question.content:
You are given an integer ‘N’ (32 bits). Your task is to make all the bits to the right of the most significant set bit as zero (0).

Example:

If the input integer is 45 i.e ‘101101’. Then after resetting the bits, it will be ‘100000’. Here The MSB set bit is 3rd from left and hence only the 3rd bit from the left will be set and the rest all the bits will be zero (0).
Input Format:
The first line contains a single integer ‘T’ representing the number of test cases. 

The first and the only line of each test case contains an Integer ‘N’ denoting the 32-bit integer whose bits need to be altered.
Output Format:
For each test case, return the integer after making all the bits to the right of the most significant set bit as zero (0).

Output for every test case will be printed in a separate line.
Note:
You don’t need to print anything; It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Follow Up:
Can you solve this using O(1) time complexity.
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 10^2
1 <= N <= 10^5


Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
2
9
6
Sample Output 1:
8
4
Explanation For Sample Output 1:
In the first test case, the given integer is 9 (1001). Thus by changing every bit to zero to the right of MSB, it becomes 8 (1000).

In the second test case, the given integer is 6 (110). Thus by changing every bit to zero to the right of MSB, it becomes 4 (100).
Sample Input 2:
2
15
25
Sample Output 2:
8
16
Explanation For Sample Output 2:
In the first test case, the given integer is 15 (11111). Thus by changing every bit to zero to the right of MSB, it becomes 8 (1000).

In the second test case, the given integer is 25 (11001). Thus by changing every bit to zero to the right of MSB, it becomes 16 (10000).

rephrased.body: Given a 32-bit integer N, modify it such that only the most significant bit (MSB) is set to 1, and all bits to its right are set to 0. Return the resulting integer.

testcases.explanation: The integer 9 in binary is 1001. The most significant bit is the 4th bit from the right. Setting all bits to the right of this bit to 0 results in 1000, which is 8 in decimal.
The integer 6 in binary is 110. The most significant bit is the 3rd bit from the right. Setting all bits to the right of this bit to 0 results in 100, which is 4 in decimal.
The integer 15 in binary is 1111. The most significant bit is the 4th bit from the right. Setting all bits to the right of this bit to 0 results in 1000, which is 8 in decimal.
The integer 25 in binary is 11001. The most significant bit is the 5th bit from the right. Setting all bits to the right of this bit to 0 results in 10000, which is 16 in decimal.

hints: Can you think of iterating the bits?
Can you think of by manipulating bits of the integer?
